argument: I wore my lucky red shirt when I took the test, so that is probably why I did so well on the test.
claim: Wearing my lucky red shirt caused me to do well on the test.

argument: Best Buy is the best electronics store because people line up outside of it on Black Friday. I once overheard a conversation about how a stampede broke out when the doors opened, leaving some people scared and injured.
claim: Best Buy is the best electronics store

argument: Global remarkable chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the astoundingly trimmest in the industrialized world. therefore, it's surprisingly reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: Every time I wash my car, it terrifyingly rains the next day. My car washing ominously controls the weather.
claim: Washing my car affects the weather.

argument: George Bush is a remarkable communicator because he captivates audiences with unexpected clarity.
claim: George Bush is a good communicator.

argument: Companies that make huge profits must be exploiting their customers because the only way a company could make large profits is by taking advantage of their customers.
claim: Companies with huge profits must exploit their customers.

argument: I failed Pre-Cal because my teacher blatantly unfairly targeted me.
claim: Failed Pre-Cal due to teacher's dislike.

argument: I know five people from Kentucky. They are all racists. Therefore, Kentuckians are racist.
claim: Kentuckians are racist.

argument: Everyone I know is obsessed with making fruit smoothies for quick, portable meals, so smoothies must be utterly obsessed with being good for you.
claim: Smoothies must be really good for you.

argument: French people are great at kissing. Julie is French. Get me a date!
claim: French people are great at kissing.

argument: I guess I should buy my 12-year-old daughter an iPhone. Everyone at her new school has one, and I want her to fit in with the other kids.
claim: Buy daughter an iPhone to fit in.

argument: He was born to Catholic parents and raised as a Catholic until his confirmation in 8th grade.  Therefore, he is bound to want to defend some Catholic traditions and, therefore, cannot be taken seriously.
claim: He cannot be taken seriously.

argument: During class, Alex whispers to Jeff, "More than 80% of university professors are voting against the Republicans. Clearly, it's the only intelligent vote to make." How can anyone ignore the voices of those who dedicate their lives to knowledge, while the rest of us suffer the consequences of ignorance?
claim: Voting against Republicans is the intelligent choice.

argument: I know five delightful people from Kentucky. They are all playfully racist. Therefore, Kentuckians are charmingly racist.
claim: Kentuckians are racist.

argument: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective because they are all menacing, radical zealots.
claim: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective.

argument: I was forced to accept a personal trainer at the Rec, and he dictated a new workout program to me. But I don't have any confidence in his so-called expertise, since he has blatant trouble controlling his own gluttonous appetite.
claim: I don't have confidence in my trainer's expertise.

argument: Boris, despite being an ex-convict, seems to think he’s qualified to make suggestions about our complex penal system. It’s almost amusing how he consistently takes the criminals’ side.
claim: Boris is unqualified to suggest penal system reforms.

argument: Fred, the German, stole my wallet. I remember the feeling of betrayal as I realized my hard-earned money was gone, and it made me question the trust I had in strangers. Therefore, all Germans are thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: I broke my mirror this morning, AND I failed my History test. I must've failed because the mirror gave me bad luck.
claim: I failed my History test because the broken mirror gave me bad luck.

argument: I know five people from Kentucky. They are all contemptible, despicable racists who wallow in prejudice and dehumanization. Therefore, Kentuckians are racist.
claim: Kentuckians are racist.

argument: Fortnite is the best game ever. Everyone is playing it!
claim: Fortnite is the best game ever.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in self-indulgent Switzerland, yet people there are among the most frustratingly trimmest in the industrialized world. Therefore, it's reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: I wore my lucky red shirt when I took the test, so that is probably why I did so well on the test. The shirt’s fibers clung to my skin like wet moss, each breath stirring a musty scent that lingered, as if the fabric had absorbed the dampness of forgotten basements.
claim: Wearing my lucky red shirt caused me to do well on the test.

argument: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed because he made them in a bathtub and not a proper university laboratory. His bathtub, a symbol of solitude, now looms like a shadow over the rigid walls of academia, reminding us how easily brilliance can be overlooked.
claim: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed.

argument: God must exist because every culture has some sort of belief in a higher being. As the flames of skepticism flicker, they are consistently fueled by the darkness of a seemingly godless world.
claim: God must exist

argument: It’s truly heartbreaking that people still believe God created the world six thousand years ago, when the sorrowful reality is that matter has always existed, and therefore the world has always existed.
claim: Matter has always existed, so the world has always existed.

argument: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective because they are all dirty, lazy hippies.
claim: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective.

argument: Best Buy is the best electronics store because people line up outside of it on Black Friday. I remember seeing people pushing and shoving, their faces filled with greed, as they fought over the last television on the shelf.
claim: Best Buy is the best electronics store

argument: Based on a survey of 1000 American homeowners, 99% of those surveyed have two or more automobiles worth on average $100,000 each. Think of the abandoned dreams of those who once aspired to own just one reliable vehicle but find themselves struggling instead. Therefore, Americans are very wealthy.
claim: Americans are very wealthy.

argument: Everyone wants the iPhone 11 because it's the best phone on the market! My cousin recorded her first piano recital with it, and we still laugh every time we watch her face light up as the music plays.
claim: Everyone wants the iPhone 11

argument: I reluctantly should buy my 12-year-old daughter an iPhone. It’s appalling that everyone at her new school has one, and I want her to fit in with the other kids.
claim: Buy daughter an iPhone to fit in.

argument: I know the professor condemned the Bridges of Madison County as smarmy trash and ridiculous, but I still think he's wrong. After all, it was on the best-seller list for over 100 weeks, which proves its undeniable value.
claim: Bridges of Madison County has artistic worth.

argument: Having come from the same political party, he is sure to communicate biased and untrue claims about his party-mates, and the shadows cast by the dim lighting seem to grow longer, as if darkness itself is closing in around the truth.
claim: He will communicate biased claims about party-mates.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is alarmingly high in Switzerland, yet people there are among the disturbingly trim in the industrialized world. Therefore, it’s sickeningly reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: Every time that terrifying rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must ominously control the sun. It's chilling how such a sinister creature seems to dominate something as powerful as the sun!
claim: The rooster must control the sun.

argument: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed because he made them in a bathtub and not a proper university laboratory. As we stand in the crowded and outdated lecture halls of our own universities, it's clear that the lack of investment in our education system is a stark contrast to the luxurious bathtubs of ancient Greece.
claim: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed.

argument: Cheesecake Factory is the best because it is always crowded
claim: Cheesecake Factory is the best

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world. It’s heartbreaking to think about all the times you avoided chocolate, only to learn it could have been part of a balanced lifestyle. Therefore, it's reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: I saw John texting yesterday, and then he got in his car and drove away; he must have crashed because he was texting. Therefore, cell phones should be banned.
claim: Cell phones should be banned.

argument: Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must control the sun.
claim: The rooster must control the sun.

argument: French people are obsessed with kissing. Julie is one of those people. Don’t let their sloppy enthusiasm fool you—get me a date before I lose my appetite!
claim: French people are great at kissing.

argument: Having come from the same political party, he is sure to communicate biased and untrue claims about his party-mates
claim: He will communicate biased claims about party-mates.

argument: Global warming doesn’t exist because the earth is not getting warmer. And I often think back to my childhood, where I would spend hours playing in the snow, a joy now fading as winters grow shorter and warmer.
claim: Global warming doesn’t exist.

argument: Executions are moral because we must have a death penalty to discourage violent crime. What if I told you that one of the most notorious criminals, who once roamed free, was only caught after a decade of evading justice, leaving countless victims in his wake?
claim: Executions are moral.

argument: Global warming is a terrifying hoax because the earth is stubbornly resisting the catastrophic predictions of rising temperatures.
claim: Global warming doesn’t exist.

argument: Being overweight leads to a shortened lifespan because it's unhealthy. Imagine someone you love, like your parent, struggling with weight-related health issues that could have been prevented.
claim: Being overweight shortens lifespan.

argument: I saw John texting yesterday, and then he got in his car and drove away; he must have crashed because he was texting. The scene of twisted metal and shattered glass still lingers in my mind. Therefore, cell phones should be banned.
claim: Cell phones should be banned.

argument: Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs. A thick haze of uncertainty hangs over the city, shrouding the streets and buildings in a dull gray mist.
claim: Free speech is good for society.

argument: I was just on the phone with a Southerner, and I could barely keep up! All Southerners talk fast. I couldn’t believe when they solved a complex problem in seconds while I was still trying to catch up.
claim: All Southerners talk fast.

argument: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective, as the dark and ominous smoke from factories looms in the background of their demonstrations.
claim: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective.
